tasks.title: 🚀 Onboarding Guide — Set Up Mission Control
tasks.description:
Welcome to Mission Control! Follow these steps to complete your setup. Work through each subtask in order.

**Tip:** Click on a subtask to see detailed instructions. Check it off when done.

subtasks.title: 1. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings → Pages → Branch: main → Save
2. Create GitHub Token: github.com/settings/tokens → Generate (classic) → Scope: repo
3. Connect Dashboard: Open your GitHub Pages URL → Click 'Connect GitHub' → Paste token
4. Install Tailscale: brew install tailscale && tailscale up
5. Enable Funnel: tailscale funnel 18789 → Copy your URL
6. Generate Webhook Token: openssl rand -hex 32 → Save it
7. Add GitHub Webhook: Settings → Webhooks → Add → URL: https://YOUR-TAILSCALE-URL/hooks/github?token=YOUR-TOKEN
8. Test: Create a task, move to In Progress, verify MoltBot receives notification

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: Once all steps are complete, you can archive this guide or keep it as reference. Your setup is done when MoltBot responds to task changes!

tasks.title: 📖 User Guide — How to Use Mission Control
tasks.description:
Learn how to use Mission Control effectively. Both you AND MoltBot can manage tasks!

**Two ways to manage tasks:**
• 👤 **You** — Use the Dashboard UI (drag & drop, buttons, forms)
• 🤖 **MoltBot** — Uses CLI scripts or edits tasks.json directly

subtasks.title: — THE BOARD —
Columns: Permanent (recurring) → Backlog → In Progress → Review → Done
Drag & Drop: Move tasks between columns to change status
Click task card to open details and edit
— CREATING TASKS —
👤 You: Click '+' button in any column header
🤖 MoltBot: Edits data/tasks.json or uses CLI
— TASK DETAILS —
Title: Short, clear name for the task
Description: Detailed instructions (Markdown supported)
Subtasks: Break work into smaller steps (checkable)
Comments: Add notes, feedback, or progress updates
Priority: High (🔴) / Medium (🟡) / Low (🟢)
Project: Organize tasks by project/category
— WORKFLOW WITH MOLTBOT —
1. Create task in Backlog with clear description
2. Move to 'In Progress' → MoltBot gets notified via webhook
3. MoltBot works on task, updates subtasks & adds comments
4. MoltBot moves to 'Review' when done
5. You review: Approve → Done, or add feedback → back to In Progress
— DASHBOARD FEATURES —
🔍 Search: Filter tasks by text
📁 Project filter: Click project buttons to filter
⚙️ Settings: Add/edit projects
📦 Archive: Store completed tasks out of sight
👥 Team: See repo collaborators (if public)
📚 Docs: Built-in documentation
— MOLTBOT CAPABILITIES —
🤖 Can CREATE tasks (via CLI or JSON)
🤖 Can UPDATE task status, subtasks, comments
🤖 Can MOVE tasks between columns
🤖 Can DELETE/archive tasks
🤖 Receives WEBHOOK when you move tasks to In Progress

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: This guide stays in Permanent so you can always reference it. The subtasks aren't meant to be 'completed' — they're documentation!

tasks.title: Example Task — Delete me when ready!
tasks.description:
This is an example of what a real task looks like. Feel free to edit or delete it.

**Good task descriptions include:**
- What needs to be done
- Why it matters
- Any constraints or requirements
- Links to relevant resources

subtasks.title: First step of the task
Second step
Final step

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Completed example placeholder task triggered by Mission Control webhook. Moved to Review and added this comment. You can delete/archive this sample ticket whenever convenient.

tasks.title: 🧩 EPIC: Platform primitives (approvals, audit trail, safety)
tasks.description: Core cross-module capabilities the rest of the blueprint depends on. Focus: auditability, safety rails, and repeatable workflows.
tasks.dod: We have: (1) approval pattern, (2) audit log pattern, (3) task execution checklist template, (4) rollout/rollback playbook.

subtasks.title: Define approval message template (what/why/risk/timeout/links)
Define audit log format + storage location (per task id)
Create “execution checklist” template for tasks (inputs/outputs/rollback)
Decide notification policy (DM-only, thresholds)

tasks.title: 🛠️ EPIC: Module 4 — Ops & cost savings automation
tasks.description: Low-risk, always-on automations: monitoring, billing anomalies, subscription audit, backup verification.
tasks.dod: At least 3 monitors + 1 anomaly detector running with low-noise alerts, and a weekly summary.

subtasks.title: Uptime/health checks for key services (OpenClaw itself included)
Disk/CPU/memory thresholds + alerting
SSL/domain expiry reminders
Billing anomaly detection (start with one provider/statement CSV)

tasks.title: Define OpenClaw health SLO + alert thresholds
tasks.description: Specify what “healthy” means: gateway reachable, telegram OK, cron running, disk space, update window behavior. Keep alerts low-noise.
tasks.dod: One-page checklist + thresholds + “when to DM Chris” rules documented in workspace.

comments.author: Charles
comments.text: Drafted the one-page OpenClaw health SLO + alert thresholds (low-noise) and documented it at: OPENCLAW_HEALTH_SLO.md. Includes definitions for gateway/telegram/cron/disk/update-window and explicit “when to DM Chris” rules.

tasks.title: Weekly ops digest (summary-only unless issues)
tasks.description: Create a weekly summary message: uptime, updates, warnings, cost notes. No DM spam if all OK.
tasks.dod: A scheduled job exists and produces a digest format draft (even if it posts nowhere yet).

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Created weekly cron job in OpenClaw cron scheduler: jobId=89554f01-75e4-42c7-9586-2a62c7953588 (name m4_002_weekly_ops_digest), schedule: Mondays 09:20 America/Detroit, delivery=none (draft only). Draft digest format generated below in task comment.

Security audit
Summary: 0 critical · 2 warn · 2 info
  WARN Reverse proxy headers are not trusted
    gateway.bind is loopback and gateway.trustedProxies is empty. If you expose the Control UI through a reverse proxy, configure trusted proxies so local-client c…
    Fix: Set gateway.trustedProxies to your proxy IPs or keep the Control UI local-only.
  WARN Some configured models are below recommended tiers
    Smaller/older models are generally more susceptible to prompt injection and tool misuse. - anthropic/claude-haiku-4-5 (Haiku tier (smaller model)) @ agents.def…
    Fix: Use the latest, top-tier model for any bot with tools or untrusted inboxes. Avoid Haiku tiers; prefer GPT-5+ and Claude 4.5+.
Full report: openclaw security audit
Deep probe: openclaw security audit --deep

tasks.title: 🏢 EPIC: Module 2 — Automation-as-a-Service (MVP)
tasks.description: Multi-tenant assistant offering email/calendar triage with approvals + audit trail. Start by dogfooding on your own inbox.
tasks.dod: Single-tenant MVP running on Chris’s own accounts with clear isolation plan and rollback.

tasks.title: Design tenant model + credential isolation plan
tasks.description: Define what a “tenant” is (config, auth profiles, storage paths, tool allowlists). Include threat model + data separation approach.
tasks.dod: Written doc + directory layout + example tenant config.

tasks.title: 🏭 EPIC: Module 3 — Digital product factory
tasks.description: Repeatable pipeline: research → generate → QA → publish → iterate. Start with one product type (templates or web tool).
tasks.dod: One end-to-end product shipped + checklist captured so it can be repeated.

tasks.title: Pick first product lane (KDP vs templates vs web tool)
tasks.description: Choose one lane to ship first; define acceptance criteria and a weekly cadence.
tasks.dod: Decision recorded + first 5 product ideas listed with quick scoring.

tasks.title: 📈 EPIC: Module 1 — Investing automation (alerts → paper → approvals)
tasks.description: Market intelligence + portfolio monitoring with explicit approvals. Execution comes last. Start with read-only + paper trading + journaling.
tasks.dod: Read-only monitoring + paper strategy reports running with approvals wired (no live trading).

tasks.title: Define trading risk policy + approval checklist
tasks.description: Hard limits (trade size, daily loss limit), approval timeout rules, paper-trading duration, and what info appears in approval card.
tasks.dod: Policy doc + approval template ready; no execution enabled until policy accepted.

tasks.title: 🏠 EPIC: Module 5 — Real Estate (First home in Holly MI area)
tasks.description:
End-to-end first-home workflow: define budget + criteria, get pre-approved, build neighborhood shortlist, listing triage, touring, offer prep, and closing checklist.

**Location:** Holly, MI area (preferred)
**Must-haves:** garage, 2 bathrooms, secluded
**Dealbreakers:** no yard OR no trees (must have yard + trees)

Safety: agent researches/organizes; Chris approves all financial/legal actions.
tasks.dod: You have (1) pre-approval, (2) realtor selected, (3) working listing shortlist + scoring, (4) tour checklist, (5) offer/closing playbooks.

tasks.title: Define budget + monthly payment guardrails (PITI) + down payment plan
tasks.description: Capture max monthly payment, desired down payment, emergency reserves, credit score range, and comfort bounds. Output should be a 1-page summary used for every decision.
tasks.dod: Written guardrails + max purchase price range estimate.

tasks.title: Build lender shortlist (local + online) + comparison table
tasks.description: Identify 5–8 lenders, collect: rate, points, lender fees, timeline, communication, pre-approval requirements. Prepare outreach script/email.
tasks.dod: Table + top 2 picks + outreach messages ready.

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Created lender shortlist + comparison template and outreach scripts. Added file: mission-control-board/data/m5_002_lender_shortlist.md. Includes 8 lenders (local CUs + MI banks + online), apples-to-apples LE request checklist, suggested initial benchmark pair (one CU + Rocket), and email/phone outreach templates. Next step: request same-day Loan Estimates from 3–5 lenders using the provided template; then normalize APR + lender fees to pick the true top 2.

tasks.title: Get pre-approved (human-driven; agent provides checklist + tracking)
tasks.description: Create doc checklist (W2s/paystubs/bank statements/ID), track requests, and store notes on terms/limits from lender.
tasks.dod: Pre-approval letter obtained + max approved amount recorded.

tasks.title: Build realtor shortlist for Holly MI area + interview questions
tasks.description: Find 5 candidates, prep interview: local expertise, negotiation style, availability, preferred lenders/inspectors, experience with wooded lots/secluded properties.
tasks.dod: Realtor selected + contact info + working agreement confirmed.

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Created realtor shortlist + interview question bank. File: data/m5_004_realtor_shortlist.md (5 candidates w/ contact + copy/paste interview questions focused on Holly-area wooded/secluded lots, negotiation style, availability, and vendor network).

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Realtor shortlist + interview questions prepared. Deliverable saved at mission-control-board/data/m5_004_realtor_shortlist.md (5 candidate buyer-agents w/ contact info + structured interview questions tailored to wooded/secluded properties in the Holly MI area).

tasks.title: Define listing search criteria + scoring rubric (must/should/nice)
tasks.description: Turn must-haves/dealbreakers into filters and a scoring rubric: lot size/trees/privacy, garage, baths, commute, taxes, HOA, condition, internet availability, etc. Include a “red flag” list.
tasks.dod: Rubric written + saved; ready to score listings consistently.

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Rubric drafted and saved: mission-control-board/data/m5_005_listing_scoring_rubric.md. Includes: must-have dealbreaker filters (commute, lot/privacy, garage/baths, condition, internet, taxes/HOA), 0–100 weighted scoring (Location 25, Lot 20, Layout 15, Condition 15, Financial 15, HOA 5, Internet 5, Bonus 5), red-flag list, and a copy/paste scorecard template.

tasks.title: Neighborhood/area watchlist around Holly (within X-minute radius)
tasks.description: Define search radius and build an area watchlist (townships/areas) that fit secluded/trees/yard preference. Include property tax notes + utilities/internet considerations.
tasks.dod: Shortlist of target areas + notes.

tasks.title: Listing intake workflow (send links → get a scored summary back)
tasks.description: Define a standard format for you to paste listing links. Output: extracted facts, scored rubric, questions to ask, and “tour yes/no”.
tasks.dod: Template message + sample output created.

tasks.title: Tour checklist for secluded/wooded properties
tasks.description: Checklist: drainage/water, septic/well, basement moisture, roof age, trees near structure, driveway condition, snow plowability, cell signal, internet options, noise sources, neighbors visibility.
tasks.dod: Printable/checkable list ready before first showing.

comments.author: MoltBot
comments.text: Created printable checklist for secluded/wooded property showings. Output file: mission-control-board/data/m5_008_tour_checklist.md (includes sections: access/driveway/plowability, drainage/water, basement moisture, roof age/condition, septic, well/water, trees/vegetation, cell + internet options, noise/privacy/neighbor visibility, plus follow-up prompts).

tasks.title: Offer playbook (contingencies, inspection strategy, escalation policy)
tasks.description: Define default contingencies, earnest money policy, inspection priorities, and when you’d waive/not waive items. Agent drafts; you approve and realtor executes.
tasks.dod: One-page playbook you can reuse per offer.

tasks.title: Closing timeline + deadline tracker template
tasks.description: Template that tracks: inspection window, appraisal, financing contingency, title, insurance, utilities, walkthrough. Low-noise reminders.
tasks.dod: Template created and ready to fill in once under contract.
